name: Heat
title: RDL + Hip Thrust + Bent Over Row

description: Assault Bike or Row x 5 min easy
World's Greatest Stretch x 5 each side

B.title: Romanian Deadlift
description: Moderate weight — focus on hamstring stretch and glute squeeze at top

C.title: Hip Thrust + Bent Over Row
description: DB Bent Over Row x 12 each arm

D.title: Banded Hamstring Curls
description: Band around ankle, prone on bench

scaling.strength: Heavier RDLs (4×6 at higher weight), add barbell rows instead of DB
scaling.conditioning: Circuit format: RDL x 8 → Hip Thrust x 12 → Row x 12 → Ham Curl x 15, 4 rounds, 60s rest

notes: Classic posterior chain day. Supports deadlift progression. Don't go so heavy you're wrecked for Friday.
excerpt: RDLs + hip thrusts — methodical, heavy, professional

name: Ronin
title: Good Morning + Glute Bridge + Face Pull

description: World's Greatest Stretch x 5 each side

B.title: Barbell Good Morning
description: Light-to-moderate weight — this is an accessory, not a max effort

C.title: Single-Leg Glute Bridge + Cable Face Pull
description: Single-Leg Glute Bridge x 10 each side
alternatives: Cable Face Pull → Band Pull-Apart x 20

scaling.strength: Heavier good mornings (4×6), add weighted back extensions
scaling.conditioning: Circuit: Good Morning x 8 → SL Glute Bridge x 10/side → Face Pull x 15 → Back Ext x 10, 4 rounds minimal rest

notes: Lighter posterior chain work. Good mornings build the same muscles as deadlifts without the CNS tax.
excerpt: Good mornings + face pulls — calculated, no wasted motion

name: The Bourne Identity
title: B-Stance RDL + Seated Row + Hamstring Curl

description: World's Greatest Stretch x 5 each side

C.title: Cable Seated Row + Hamstring Curl
description: Machine or Banded Hamstring Curl x 12

D.title: Anti-Extension
description: Ab Wheel Rollout x 8–10 (or Plank x 30s)

scaling.strength: Heavier B-stance RDL, add barbell rows, 4 sets on everything
scaling.conditioning: Circuit format, 4 rounds, 45s rest between rounds

notes: B-stance RDL is a unilateral posterior chain builder. Great for identifying L/R imbalances.

name: Escape from New York
title: KB Swing + Pull-Up + Farmer Carry

description: Assault Bike or Row x 5 min easy
World's Greatest Stretch x 5 each side

scaling.strength: Heavier KB (32/24kg), weighted pull-ups, heavier carry (2×32/24kg)
scaling.conditioning: As written, push for unbroken carry

notes: More conditioning-flavored posterior chain work. KB swings + pull-ups are a HYROX-relevant pairing.
excerpt: KB swings + pull-ups + carry — scrappy, resourceful

name: Mission Impossible
title: DB Bench + Dips + Tricep Pushdown

description: World's Greatest Stretch x 5 each side

D.title: Pressing Core
alternatives: Pallof Press → Band Anti-Rotation Hold x 20s each side

scaling.strength: Heavier DB bench (4×8), weighted dips, 4 sets on everything
scaling.conditioning: Circuit: DB Bench x 10 → Dips x 15 → Pushdown x 15 → Plank x 30s, 4 rounds, 60s rest

notes: Pressing volume to support bench progression. DB bench builds stabilizers barbell doesn't hit.
excerpt: DB bench + dips — executing the plan

name: Batman Begins
title: DB Z-Press + Push-Ups + Lateral Raise

description: World's Greatest Stretch x 5 each side

notes: Z-press forces strict pressing with no leg drive or back arch. Humbling but effective for OHP transfer.
excerpt: Z-press — humbling, foundational, building from nothing

name: The Untouchables
title: Incline DB Press + Dips + Skull Crushers

description: World's Greatest Stretch x 5 each side

C.title: Dips + Skull Crushers
description: Ring Dips or Bar Dips x 8–12
alternatives: Skull Crushers → Overhead DB Tricep Extension

D.title: Loaded Carry + Plank
description: Overhead DB Carry x 50m (single arm, switch halfway)

scaling.strength: Heavier incline press (4×8), weighted dips, 4 sets everything
scaling.conditioning: Circuit: Incline x 10 → Dips x 12 → Skull Crush x 12 → Carry x 50m, 4 rounds, 60s rest

notes: Incline pressing builds upper chest and front delt — transfers directly to overhead press.
excerpt: Incline press + skull crushers — clean, organized, effective

name: Fight Club
title: Push-Up Variations + KB Press + Hollow Body

description: World's Greatest Stretch x 5 each side

B.title: Push-Up Variation + KB Press
description: Min 1: Push-Up Variation x 10 (rotate: standard / diamond / wide / archer)
Min 2: Single-Arm KB Press x 6 each arm @ 16/12kg

scaling.strength: Heavier KB (24/16kg), deficit push-ups, 15 min EMOM (5 rounds)

notes: Minimal equipment pressing day. Push-up variation rotation hits all angles. Track your max set over time.
excerpt: Push-up variations EMOM — first rule: don't talk about it

name: Crouching Tiger
title: 90/90 Flow + Pistol Progression + Step-Up

description: Child's Pose with Lateral Reach x 30s each side
Supine Figure-Four Stretch x 60s each side

B.title: Hip Flow
description: 90/90 Hip Switches x 8 each side (slow and controlled)
Pigeon Pose Hold x 45s each side
Deep Squat Hold x 30s (hold bottom of squat, push knees out)

C.title: Pistol Squat Progression + Step-Up
description: Seated Pistol Squat x 6 each leg (to box, lower box as you progress)
DB Step-Up x 8 each leg @ 20" box
alternatives: Pistol → Assisted Pistol with band or TRX

scaling.strength: Heavier step-ups, lower box for pistols, add weighted vest
scaling.conditioning: Add Assault Bike x 3 min between each round of section B

notes: Mobility focus — 90/90s are a known weak spot. Progressive overload the pistol box height over weeks.

name: The Karate Kid
title: Shoulder Flow + Turkish Get-Up + Balance Work

description: Thread the Needle x 8 each side

B.title: Turkish Get-Up
description: Full range of motion every rep

C.title: Single-Leg Balance + Shoulder Stability
description: Single-Leg RDL x 8 each side (BW or light DB)
KB Windmill x 5 each side @ light weight
Single-Leg Balance Hold x 30s each side (eyes closed if possible)

D.title: Stretch
description: Doorway Pec Stretch x 45s each side

scaling.conditioning: Add Assault Bike x 2 min between rounds of section C

notes: TGU is the ultimate full-body movement quality test. Low weight, high attention. Great for SI/lumbar health.
excerpt: TGU + balance — wax on, wax off

name: Blade Runner
title: Bulgarian Split Squat + Lateral Work + Hip Flow

description: Lateral Band Walk x 15 each direction
World's Greatest Stretch x 5 each side

C.title: Lateral Lunge + Banded Lateral Walk
description: DB Lateral Lunge x 8 each side
Banded Lateral Walk x 15 each direction

scaling.strength: Heavier BSS (4×6), add barbell BSS, 4 sets on superset
scaling.conditioning: Circuit: BSS x 8/side → Lat Lunge x 8/side → Band Walk x 15/side → 90/90 x 8/side, 4 rounds, 60s rest

notes: BSS is arguably the best single-leg exercise for squat transfer. Lateral work addresses the frontal plane.
excerpt: Bulgarian split squat + lateral — precision engineering

name: Big Trouble in Little China
title: Cossack Squat + Single-Leg Deadlift + Ankle/Hip Flow

description: World's Greatest Stretch x 5 each side

B.title: Cossack Squat + Single-Leg Deadlift
description: Cossack Squat x 6 each side (KB goblet hold optional)
Single-Leg Deadlift x 8 each side (KB or DB)

C.title: Ankle + Hip Flow
description: Wall Ankle Stretch x 30s each side

scaling.strength: Heavier KB for Cossack and SLDL, 4 sets
scaling.conditioning: Add 3 min Assault Bike between sections B and C

notes: Cossack squats build hip mobility under load — directly transfers to squat depth. Lighter day overall.
excerpt: Cossack squat + hip flow — weird, wonderful, secretly brilliant
